oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Silver Star of Pvt. Robert Rufus Rust, Co. K, 117th Inf. Regt., 30th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Silver Star is suspended on a blue, white and red silk ribbon. The reverse is marked "FOR /GALLANTRY IN ACTION" with "ROBERT R. RUST" engraved below. The medal number is "4752." Rust, a Kentucky native, moved to Adams, Tenn. before WWI. During an attack, Rust had his rifle shot from his hands. He picked up an abandoned Lewis gun and silenced a German machine gun. He received the Silver Star and the British Military Medal. He later moved to Old Hickory, Tenn. and worked at the DuPont Plant.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World war, 1914-1918; World war, 1914-1918 - History
